poem:
**Shifting Sands**

Among ruins,  
the desert gathers echoes—  
cries woven  
with the dust,  
children scatter grains of hope—  
eyes unfed, grasping at shadows  
thrown by the sun.  
Seven wise men promised to weave  
threads of justice,  
yet the loom stands barren,  
its silence louder  
than the wailing winds  
in vast, forgotten lands.
